summary: The Indian Health Service provides health care to over 2 million American Indians and Alaska Natives. These groups have been disproportionately vulnerable to negative outcomes from COVID-19 . Despite facing an unprecedented demand for medical supplies, IHS was able to acquire necessary products (including personal protective equipment and lab supplies) from a variety of vendors during the pandemic. However, we found that IHS's contracting officials...
title: COVID-19 Contracting: Indian Health Service Used Flexibilities to Meet Increased Medical Supply Needs
